privacy.header1: I. Responsible for data processing and data protection officer:
privacy.header5: V. Right of appeal to the competent supervisory authority
privacy.text1: Altklausuren.mathphys.info is a platform that provides exam questions from past semesters for students at Heidelberg University. In order to provide this service, we need to store and process personal data of our users. In our privacy policy, we explain how we use your data, what rights you have, and who your contacts are.
privacy.text2: The old exams and exam reports on the platform (altklausuren.mathphys.info) are provided to complement the scientific education and training at Heidelberg University. By logging in using the Uni-ID, it is ensured that the user is enrolled at the university and therefore has the right to access. The other collected data are used to personalize the old examinations and examination reports which are provided. The personalization is used to prevent the user from passing on copyrighted material without the declaration of consent of the concerned lecturer.)
privacy.text3: In principle, we only process personal data if this is necessary for the purpose of offering the service (Art. 6 para. (1) b) DSGVO). The processing of your data is necessary for the use of the platform. Without this possibility of processing your data can not be used.
privacy.text4: When using altklausuren.mathphys.info, the following data is collected:
privacy.text5: The storage of connection data, in particular the IP address, by the system is necessary to enable delivery of the website to the user's computer. For this purpose, the IP address of the user must remain stored for the duration of the session. The connection data is also stored in log files. We use the data to optimize the website and to ensure the security of our information technology systems.
privacy.text6: The following data has already been stored by the University Computer Center of Heidelberg University and will be automatically transferred to the database during registration:
privacy.text7: Explanation of functions on the platform: As part of the use of our service, content is provided on the platform in the form of PDF files. After logging in, the user can search for exam reports and old exams in the database. In order to make it more difficult to share the exam reports and old exams in violation of copyright law, the user's Uni-ID is printed all over the pages when viewing and downloading old exams. The data on the website can be viewed by lecturers and students of the Faculty of Mathematics and Computer Science and the Faculty of Physics and Astronomy at Heidelberg University. The MathPhysInfo student council entrusts individual students with the administration, system management and further development of the website. Only these individuals have access to the aforementioned data. However, they process this data only to the extent necessary to ensure the proper operation of the learning platform.
privacy.text8: Access to the content data is logged in so-called log files, e.g. at what time which user accesses which exam. This data is only accessible to the administrators of the platform, but not to other users. They are used exclusively for technical optimization and are not passed on to other persons. The data in the log files are deleted after 10 days.
privacy.text9: The use of technical cookies serves to simplify the use of the website for the user. Some functions cannot be offered without the use of cookies. The following cookies are used:
privacy.text10: Connection data in the log files of the web server are automatically deleted after 10 days. Usage data is automatically deleted 10 days after the end of the usage process. Users can obtain further information at any time by sending an informal e-mail to the following e-mail address root@mathphys.stura.uni-heidelberg.de.
privacy.text11: In the event of a violation of legal regulations for the protection of data stored on you, you can contact the competent supervisory authority. The competent supervisory authority is
privacy.text12: Please first speak to the faculty data protection officer. In most cases, this will clarify questions and resolve complaints.
privacy.list1: The login name of the user. This is equal to the uni ID or project ID respectively.
privacy.list2: The password of the Uni ID or Project ID is checked but not saved.
privacy.list3: The last name of the user
privacy.list4: The first name of the users
privacy.list5: The user's e-mail address, which was assigned by Heidelberg University as part of the enrollment process
privacy.list6: Session: This cookie must be allowed so that the login is preserved when accessing from page to page. When you log out or exit the web browser, the cookie is automatically deleted.
privacy.list7: UID: This cookie stores the login name in the web browser exclusively after activation of the corresponding checkbox by the user and remains even after logging out.
